claim: Carlo Jacobs did not receive any funds on 9/9/2019; his first disbursement was on 9/10/2019 for $50.
extra_info: full name refers to first_name, last_name, amount of funds received refers to amount, received funds on date refers to date_received
reasoning: The database shows Carlo Jacobs received $50 on 2019-09-09 (9/9/2019), not on 9/10/2019. The claim states he did not receive any funds on 9/9/2019 and that his first disbursement was on 9/10/2019, but both assertions are contradicted by the income record showing a $50 payment on 9/9/2019.

content.text: I'll verify this claim step by step. Let me first explore the database schema, then check the specific facts.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
attendance  event       income      member    
budget      expense     major       zip_code

tool_use_result.stdout:
attendance  event       income      member    
budget      expense     major       zip_code

content.content:
CREATE TABLE event
(
    event_id   TEXT
        constraint event_pk
            primary key,
    event_name TEXT,
    event_date TEXT,
    type       TEXT,
    notes      TEXT,
    location   TEXT,
    status     TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE major
(
    major_id   TEXT
        constraint major_pk
            primary key,
    major_name TEXT,
    department TEXT,
    college    TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE zip_code
(
    zip_code    INTEGER
        constraint zip_code_pk
            primary key,
    type        TEXT,
    city        TEXT,
    county      TEXT,
    state       TEXT,
    short_state TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "attendance"
(
    link_to_event  TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    primary key (link_to_event, link_to_member),
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "budget"
(
    budget_id     TEXT
            primary key,
    category      TEXT,
    spent         REAL,
    remaining     REAL,
    amount        INTEGER,
    event_status  TEXT,
    link_to_event TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "expense"
(
    expense_id          TEXT
            primary key,
    expense_description TEXT,
    expense_date        TEXT,
    cost                REAL,
    approved            TEXT,
    link_to_member      TEXT,
    link_to_budget      TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_budget) references budget(budget_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "income"
(
    income_id      TEXT
        constraint income_pk
            primary key,
    date_received  TEXT,
    amount         INTEGER,
    source         TEXT,
    notes          TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "member"
(
    member_id     TEXT
        constraint member_pk
            primary key,
    first_name    TEXT,
    last_name     TEXT,
    email         TEXT,
    position      TEXT,
    t_shirt_size  TEXT,
    phone         TEXT,
    zip           INTEGER,
    link_to_major TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_major) references major(major_id),
    foreign key (zip) references zip_code(zip_code)
);

CREATE TABLE event
(
    event_id   TEXT
        constraint event_pk
            primary key,

);

(
    major_id   TEXT
        constraint major_pk
            primary key,
    major_name TEXT,
    department TEXT,

);
CREATE TABLE zip_code
(
    zip_code    INTEGER
        constraint zip_code_pk
            primary key,
    type        TEXT,
    city        TEXT,
    county      TEXT,
    state       TEXT,
    short_state TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "attendance"
(
    link_to_event  TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    primary key (link_to_event, link_to_member),
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "budget"
(
    budget_id     TEXT
            primary key,
    category      TEXT,
    spent         REAL,
    remaining     REAL,
    amount        INTEGER,
    event_status  TEXT,

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "expense"
(

            primary key,
    expense_description TEXT,

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "income"
(

    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "member"
(

        constraint member_pk
            primary key,
    first_name    TEXT,
    last_name     TEXT,

    phone         TEXT,
    zip           INTEGER,
    link_to_major TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_major) references major(major_id),

);

content.text: Now let me check Carlo Jacobs' income records, specifically around 9/9/2019 and 9/10/2019.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/student_club.sqlite" "SELECT i.income_id, i.date_received, i.amount, i.source, m.first_name, m.last_name FROM income i JOIN member m ON i.link_to_member = m.member_id WHERE m.first_name = 'Carlo' AND m.last_name = 'Jacobs' ORDER BY i.date_received;"
input.description: Get all income records for Carlo Jacobs

content.text:
This is very revealing. The data shows:

1. **Carlo Jacobs has exactly one income record**, dated **2019-09-09** (9/9/2019) for **$50** from "Dues".

The claim asserts:
- "Carlo Jacobs did not receive any funds on 9/9/2019" → **CONTRADICTED** — the data shows he received $50 on 9/9/2019.
- "His first disbursement was on 9/10/2019 for $50" → **CONTRADICTED** — his only (and therefore first) record is on 9/9/2019, not 9/10/2019.

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "The database shows Carlo Jacobs received $50 on 2019-09-09 (9/9/2019), not on 9/10/2019. The claim states he did not receive any funds on 9/9/2019 and that his first disbursement was on 9/10/2019, but both assertions are contradicted by the income record showing a $50 payment on 9/9/2019."}
```
